line.en: 'Hello?'
At lunch break, Ageha and I were called to the\nstaff room.
It's because we were both absent yesterday.
'We told the truth and said we were 'hanging\nout', and got a really severe scolding from our\nhomeroom teacher.
Well, that can't be helped.
'It's a good thing they didn't contact our\nparents.'
'Yeah...'
Ageha isn't her usual cheerful self this morning.
'...I said something terrible yesterday, didn't\nI?'
'I couldn't stop myself from getting angry.'
'Don't worry about it. You know, Kotori\nunderstood why you did that.'
Actually she was regretting it too. The fact that\nshe had an argument with Ageha.
'No, that's not it. I think that maybe the reason\nwhy I got angry then was because she was exactly\nright.'
'And she said that I kiss up to everyone to make\nthem like me...'
'You don't kiss up to people though, do you?'
'...I wonder.'

'There are lots of people who I get along with.
But, I don't feel the same way I do with them as
I do with you guys when we hang out, like 'close
friends.'
I guess that Ageha can get along with anyone.\nBut, it doesn't feel like there is anybody she is\nparticularly close to.
To be honest, I thought that was a little\nstrange.
'I'm the same. I got along with everyone in the\nCycle Racing Club but I couldn't talk to them in\nthe same way I can talk to you guys.'
That is a question of time, I hadn't spent the\nsame amount of time with them.
Me, Ageha and the others were each other's very\nfirst friends, here, in this neighborhood, back\nbefore I can even remember.
If there was anyone else who I got along with...
Idiot! Moron! Knucklehead!!
Suddenly, all those insults spring to mind.
'(Do we really... get along?)'
'It was true that the teacher asked me to do\nit...'
'I was told to make it easy for her to join in\nwith everyone.'
'Even if you weren't told to, you were worried\nabout Kotori anyway, weren't you?'
'That's what I thought but... I wasn't sure I\ncould do anything about it.'
'In the end, it had the opposite effect.'
Kotori is taking a day off school today too.
Ageha thought it was her fault and was blaming\nherself.
This morning, when I woke up, Kotori had already\nleft.
There were signs that the kitchen had been messed\nup, and it looked like she had been searching for\nthe withdrawal notice that I hid.
Actually, it was in the drawer in my room.
'It's not your fault that Kotori hasn't come to\nschool.'
'Why do you think that?'
'It's not just what I think, I'm almost\ncompletely certain.'
'The truth is...'
I remembered that we were in the hallway of the\nschool, and took quick look around.
There was nobody passing, so I didn't have to\nworry about anyone hearing.
'Kotori wants to quit school.'
'From a long time ago... Seems like she had\ndecided before I came back here.'
Ageha was surprised to hear this out of the blue,\nand didn't say anything.
'Then...'
'It's not because she argued with the girls in\nthe class. There's a... deeper reason for it.'
'I think that it is also the reason for her\nrecent behavior and attitude.'
'So, that's also why she didn't join the Soaring\nClub...'
'Yeah. Since she was planning to quit school\nsoon, she thought it would just cause problems\nfor us.'
'Is that so... So, yesterday's argument...'
'...was because you both misunderstood each\nother.'
'That can't be it! We still haven't cleared\nthings up since the argument!'
'If Kotori disappears as things are now, I don't\nknow what I'll do!'
BAM! BAM!
Ageha takes her unfocused anger out on me, by\nhitting my chest.
'Ow ow ow!'
'You should've told me that sooner, you idiot!'
'I only found out by coincidence! Also... ouch! I\ncan't just go around telling other people her\nsecrets, can I?'

I just picked up the withdrawal notice by
coincidence, so I didn't know when she was
planning on submitting it, or even if she was
really serious about it.
I couldn't exactly ask her about it either.
'But... but...!'
BAM! BAM!
'I'm sorry, OK! That hurts, seriously, stop\npunching me!'
Then...
'(I thought that she didn't want to quit school\nanymore...)'
She'd been coming to school, helping with the\nmeal preparations at the dormitory, and it looked\nlike she was enjoying herself.
I just assumed that everything was OK now.
'...On the way home today, I'm going there to\napologize. Aoi, come with me.'
'Yeah, sure.'
'...sniff.'
In an attempt to offer some comfort to Ageha, who\nwas now crying, I stroked her head.
Anyway, today is Friday.
It was the deadline of the grace period for\ngathering club members, given to us by the\nstudent council vice president Akari Kumoi.
After school, Ageha and I, and then one other\nperson went to the Soaring Club's garage.
The vice president came to see the four of us one\nby one, including club leader Amane as we lined\nup.
'...Heh heh...'
'...(Angry)'
A vein was clearly visible on the vice\npresident's temple!
'Who is this?'
'What do you mean? She's the new member...'
'I'm the new club member, Kanako Shigure!'
'Rejected!'
'Wha...whaaaaat!?'
'Please explain!'
'Yes, yes!'
'I told you that ghost members wouldn't be\naccepted.'
'What exactly are you assuming here?'
'This is the tyranny of the student council!'
'Yes, yes! What's wrong with me longing for the\nsky!'
'Six previous cases. This person is a repeat\noffender of acting as a ghost member!'
'Whaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaat!!!!!?'
'Well, I get bored easily!'
'That is why I reject it.'
'C'mon, it's OK, isn't it? We're in the same\nclass, aren't we?'
'You two are in the same class...?'
I guess they are in the same grade.
'C'mon, Akari-chan!'
'Please don't cling to me like that.'
She gets rid of Kanako with a flat refusal.
It seems that she's used to dealing with her.
'Are there any other members?'
'In that case, the club's status is repealed.'
'...Vice president, here.'
Amane sheepishly passes her a printed out piece\nof paper.
It was the results of the Soaring Club's\nactivities that she had compiled.
'What do you think?'
'In all of these years you have only flown once,\na few days ago. Also, the fact that this occurred\nduring lesson time is an outrage.'

'You're not aiming to take part in any
competitions, don't participate in school
festivals, and you haven't really provided any
announcements of your work or research.'
'...This falls into the category of an extremely\nindividual hobby. Wouldn't this be the kind of\nactivity in which a circle would be involved?'
'(A...Amane!)'
'(You can't just meekly admit it like that!)'
'It's no good, is it, vice president?'
'Whatever happens, there's a place I'd like to go\nto...'
There was something that sounded like a desperate\nappeal in Amane's voice.
'A place you'd like to go to...?'
'I promised Isuka...'
The vice president said nothing as she looked at\nher, as if trying to figure out the true meaning.
'...That's right.'
'There are only three members, which is not\nenough. There have been no research\nannouncements.'
'However...'
'However?'
'Hmm? You...'
The vice president looked as if she was about to\nsay something very important, and looked behind\nus, towards the back of the garage.
'Kotori!'
There, was Kotori.
She had entered at some point.
'...I have something to give back.'
she said to Amane.
'To me?'
But Kotori did not come towards us.
Next to the glider with its sheet removed, she\nwas looking down slightly at something on her\nlap.
Amane walked over to her.
'What is it...?'
'Once this is complete, will it fly above the\nclouds?'
'Huh?'
Kotori looks at the white, sleek aircraft.
And then, she held out the thing that was on her\nlap; a photograph.
'Can it go to this place?'
'This is...'
When Amane saw it, she was wide eyed with\nsurprise.
'...This photo, where did you find it?'
Tears welled up in her eyes.
'What is it?'
'I dunno...'
Ageha and I walked over there, to take a look at\nthe photograph that Kotori was holding.
It was a photograph of clouds.
A sunset, dyed in indigo and orange...
Or was it sunrise?
In the beautifully-colored, clear morning glow,\nwas a huge row of clouds, which looked similar to\na passage extending across the sky.
This must be...the passage of clouds.
'It's beautiful...'
'Yeah...'
Ageha and I, Kanako and the vice president, were\nall fascinated by the miraculous spectacle shown\nin the photograph.
'Can it go to this place...?'
Kotori asked again.
For a moment, I couldn't make the mental\nconnection between the question and the view in\nthe photograph.
That was because it was a place too far away to\nbe associated with the word 'go'.
'This place...'
'Will you go to this place...? ...Above the\nclouds?'
...Riding this glider.
As I look at the photograph, I envision the white\naircraft without an engine -- flying across the\nsky, being so graceful, great, and solemn.
That really was a miraculous sight.
All of us, even Akari, held our breath as we\nwaited for Amane's answer.
...Can it go to this place?
'...Yeah, it can go there.'
She murmured as she took the photograph and\nlooked at it nostalgically.
'That's what Isuka said. She's a genius!'
Amane, who had until just now had tears in her\neyes, smiled happily as she said that name.
'I... want to... join too.'
'...That's if someone like me won't be a burden.'
She spoke with both fear and a lack of confidence\nin her voice.
However, in her eyes seemed to be a strong\ndetermination.
When Amane saw those eyes, she answered...
'Of course, you're very welcome.'
